title: Impact of change in USD-euro exchange rate

content.question: The United States and the European Union are trading partners with flexible exchange rates. The currency of the United States is the dollar (<math alttext="dollar symbol" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo></math>), and the currency of the European Union is the euro. Which of the following is true if the exchange rate between the euro and the dollar changes from <math alttext="$1.00" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo><mn>1.00</mn></math> per euro to <math alttext="$1.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo><mn>1.25</mn></math> per euro?

choices.label: United States exports to Europe will increase.
European exports to the United States will increase.
The money supply in the United States will increase.

content.answer: United States exports to Europe will increase.

topic.text: 6.5: Changes in the Foreign Exchange Market and Net Exports
